item.title: Realtor-Backed Incubator Invests in Ethereum Identity Startup - CoinDesk
item.description:
Realtor-Backed Incubator Invests in Ethereum Identity Startup - CoinDesk

A startup seeking to use the Ethereum blockchain and artificial intelligence to create an identity authentication system has been accepted into REach, an incubator backed by the investment arm of the National Association of Realtors (NAR).

item.title: Bitcoin Markets: Black and Gray, White and Red
item.description:
Bitcoin Markets: Black and Gray, White and Red

The markets context of cryptocurrencies is changing in what may seem like a subtle manner but has real political consequences. One question is the pivot point. Should Bitcoin maintain the pseudonymity that offers privacy or should government identify users through such measures as imposing Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements on exchanges?

item.title: Compact Block Relay Improve Propagation Times Bitcoin Network
item.description:
Compact Block Relay Improve Propagation Times Bitcoin Network

Bitcoin Core, the open source project which maintains and releases Bitcoin client software, has fully embraced BIP152, a new upgrade that will reduce the amount of bandwidth used to propagate new blocks to full nodes. This will decrease the amount of time it takes for a block to propagate across the entire Bitcoin network.

item.title: White Hat Hacker Saved Uber From Login Bypass Exploit
item.description:
White Hat Hacker Saved Uber From Login Bypass Exploit

As it turns out, no company is safe from exploits or vulnerabilities. Not even Uber, who paid a researcher US$10,000, to not reveal his login bypass exploit. Such a vulnerability could effectively cripple the service if the information got into the wrong hands. The security vulnerability would have had some nasty effects on the network.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Straddling The Trade - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Straddling The Trade - NEWSBTC

Here's what we are focusing on for this morning's session in the bitcoin price. We're heading into the middle of the week, and action so far has given us plenty to go at.

item.title: Further Economic Woes In Turkey Create Bitcoin Opportunities
item.description:
Further Economic Woes In Turkey Create Bitcoin Opportunities

Financial trouble continues to brew in Turkey, as the economy minister was not overly confident when discussing the situation in the country. The central bank is expected to continue cutting its lending rate. Now that PayPal has also left the scene in Turkey, Bitcoin can start gaining popularity in the region.

item.title: Brief Bitcoin Price Dip Followed By Another Upward Trend
item.description:
Brief Bitcoin Price Dip Followed By Another Upward Trend

The Bitcoin price has started to dip again slightly, although the big crash some people expected has not occurred. It is normal to see some price corrections now and then, and looking back at the charts, things are slowly starting to recover again.

item.title: Major Hong Kong Daily Pins Bitcoin as China's "New Darling"
item.description:
Major Hong Kong Daily Pins Bitcoin as China's "New Darling"

In an article published today, a writer for the South China Morning Post - Hong Kong's newspaper of record and the leading English-language newspaper in the country - explores why bitcoin is finding favor among investors in China.

item.title: Bitcoin Featuring FinTech Platform Stripe Lands in France
item.description:
Bitcoin Featuring FinTech Platform Stripe Lands in France

The expansion of Stripe has not gone by unnoticed, as the service is now available in no less than 25 countries. France is a country of conflicts and odd decisions at times. Albeit the Front National wants to ban Bitcoin altogether, yet Fintech startup Stripe is now available in the country.

item.title: How MIT & Learning Machine Will Put Your Degree on the Blockchain
item.description:
How MIT & Learning Machine Will Put Your Degree on the Blockchain

Storing educational credentials on a distributed ledger in a transparent manner makes a lot of sense. MIT Media Lab and Learning Machine has done exactly that, allowing individuals to share digital proof of their education and employment.
